title: Academic activities update
text:
Abstract submitted to the International Congress of Nutrion of Internationa Union of Nutritional Sciences.
Title: Expert guidelines on improving the quality of published aquatic food nutrient composition data for their inclusion in FCTs, FCDs, and evidenced based nutritional plans, policies and programmes.
Authors: Thiruchenduran Somasundaram1; Rita Hannisdal2; Siân Astley3; Hettie Schönfeldt4; Ananthan Rajendran5; Doris Rittenschober6; Fernanda Grande6; Sitilitha Masangwi7; Kendra Byrd8; Christina Hicks9; Marian Kjellevold10; International Community Of Practice On Nutrient Composition Of Aquatic Foods11




A brainstorming collaborative activity was carried out at Institute of Marine Research, Bergen from the 20th - 24th January, 2025 for the preparation of best practice checklist and guidance for producing aquatic food nutrient composition data. The activity was carried out between Dr. T C Somasundaram, Professor M Kjellevold, and Dr R Hannisdal



A collaborative manuscript drafting workshop with the aquatic food composition database experts from America, Australia, Belgium, France, Ghana, India, Italy, Malawi, South Africa, Spain, and United Kingdom. This writing workshop lasted for four days from the 14th - 17th January. The sessions resulted in three draft future focused manuscripts.



An excellence in research award (1st place) was given to the entire team who participated in the FAO - EAF NANSEN project, conducting the ecosystem survey in Sri Lankan waters while on-board the R/V Dr Fridtjof Nansen at the event organised by Sri Lanka Council for Agricultural Research and Policy in Colombo, December 2024.

title: Dr Thiru C Somasundaram
text:
Greetings and welcome to my scholar website, where you can get my research and scholarly updates as they happen along with additional links to connected resources.
I am Dr Thiruchenduran Somasundaram also called as Dr Thiru C Somasundaram, T Somasundaram or simply Thiru.
I am currently located at Deakin Marine Centre, Queenscliff, Victoria 3225, Australia. Please say hi to me, if you visit our amazing research facility and want to know more about my research in-person.





Academic activity updates

IUNS-ICN






IUNS-ICN: Abstract submission





Abstract submitted to the International Congress of Nutrition of International Union of Nutritional Sciences, France August 2025.
Title: Expert guidelines on improving the quality of published aquatic food nutrient composition data for their inclusion in FCTs, FCDs, and evidenced based nutritional plans, policies and programmes.
Authors: Thiruchenduran Somasundaram1; Rita Hannisdal2; Siân Astley3; Hettie Schönfeldt4; Ananthan Rajendran5; Doris Rittenschober6; Fernanda Grande6; Sitilitha Masangwi7; Kendra Byrd8; Christina Hicks9; Marian Kjellevold10; International Community Of Practice On Nutrient Composition Of Aquatic Foods11





IMR: Bergen, Norway






IMR: Bergen, Norway Academic visit





A brainstorming collaborative activity was carried out at Institute of Marine Research, Bergen from the 20th - 24th January, 2025 for the preparation of best practice checklist and guidance for producing aquatic food nutrient composition data. The activity was carried out between Dr. T C Somasundaram, Professor M Kjellevold, and Dr R Hannisdal





ICoP: Rome, Italy






ICoP: Rome, Italy. Writing workshop





A collaborative manuscript drafting workshop with the aquatic food composition database experts from America, Australia, Belgium, France, Ghana, India, Italy, Malawi, South Africa, Spain, and United Kingdom. This writing workshop lasted for four days from the 14th - 17th January. The sessions resulted in three draft future focused manuscripts.





SLCARP Awards, Colombo






SLCARP Awards, Colombo, SL Research Excellence





The NANSEN project was awarded SLCARP prestigious national award on the 16th December 2024. An excellence in research award (1st place) was given to the entire team who participated in the FAO - EAF NANSEN project, conducting the ecosystem survey in Sri Lankan waters while on-board the R/V Dr Fridtjof Nansen at the event organised by Sri Lanka Council for Agricultural Research and Policy in Colombo.





BOKU University, Vienna, Austria






BOKU University, Vienna, Austria - Academic visit





An academic and a paper discussion at the BOKU University, Vienna with a Ph.D. Scholar





Bonn University, Bonn, Germany






Bonn University, Bonn, Germany - Lab visit





Had a priviledge to visit the oxysterol labs at the Department of Clinical Pharmacology, Bonn University and listen to an informative lecture from Prof. Dieter Lütjohann.





** ★ Published- Food Research International (IF 7)**






** ★ Published Food Research International (IF 7)**





The third paper from my Ph.D. thesis was published in the Food Research Interantional, an Elsevier journal. The paper titled Nutrient based classification of Phyllospora comosa biomasses using machine learning algorithms: Towards sustainable valorisation was co-authroed with Tom Mock, Damien Callahan and David Francis of Deakin University





Erasmus MC, Rotterdam, The Netherlands






Erasmus MC, Rotterdam, The Netherlands - Training





A training on the fucosterols estimation and their functionalities was carried out at the Lipid Labs at Erasmus Medical Centre, Rotterdam for the fermentation samples from my Ph.D. work.





EFFoST - Brugges, Belgium






EFFoST - Brugges, Belgium - Poster presentation





Presented two of my Ph.D. papers (one published and one still draft) at the European Federation for Food Science and Technology conference at Brugges, Belgium in November 2024.





Deakin Warrnambool, Melbourne, Australia






Deakin Warrnambool, Melbourne, Australia - Invited lecture





I delivered a lecture on sustainable use of seaweeds in agriculture to the visiting consular corps Melbourne at Deakin Warrnambool campus.





Invited lecture, Kanpur






Invited lecture at Azad University - Kanpur, India





Delivered an invited lecture on “Marine Food and Nutritional Resources” under the CAAST-NC project organized under the title “Recent Advances in Functional and Nutraceuticals for Future Foods” at Chandra Shekhar Azad University of Agriculture and Technology, Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, India for Master students, Ph.D. students & Faculty members on 20/07/2019,





FAO Workshop, Rome






FAO workshop on nutrition and food safety





Attended the workshop on nutrition and food safety at FAO, Rome, from 2-4 July 2019 and made a presentation on “Nutrition and Food Security - issues from an Asian perspective”. Further, engaged in the workshop in furthering the manuscripts from the EAF-NANSEN survey 2017.





IMR Workshop, Bergen






IMR workshop on nutrition and food safety





Workshop on Nutrition and Food Safety, Institute of Marine Research. Bergen 13-15 November 2018 Based on EAF Nansen Ecological Survey conducted on board of research vessel Dr Fridtjof Nansen in 2017

title: Professional academic experience
text:
2025 : A year of publications in the making







October 2024 - January 2025

Researcher, Lancaster Environment Center, Lancaster University, United Kingdom (Remote). As a part and on-behalf of an international team called “International Community of Practice on Nutrient Composition of Aquatic Foods”, I organised all the logistics (Flights, Visas, Ground transport, Meals and snacks, Accommodation, Venue, Remote Connectivity, Reimbursements, Health and safety) necessary to conduct a successful writing workshop in Rome, Italy for 18 in-person and 4 remote participants. This workshop was funded by Lancaster Environment Center and supervised by Professor Christina Hicks.
Project cost ~ £ 30,000











2024 : A year of doctoral graduation and collaborations







February 2024 - December 2025

Casual Research Fellow, Nutrition and Seafood Laboratory (NuSea.Lab), Deakin University (Deakin Marine) at Queenscliff, Victoria 3225, Australia. As a research fellow I was involved in experimental designs, sampling protocol preparation, and biochemical analysis of feeds and tissue sample arising from a coral husbandry experiment carried out in collaboration with the Australian Institute of Marine Science, Townsville, Queensland, Australia. I also was involved in data engineering, data curation, scripting, data analysis and interpretation of the results of 3 experiments under this project.
Project cost ~ A$ 305,000











2020 - 2023 : An academic in the making







January 2022 - December 2022

Research Consultant, Freelancer. I provided research consultation for an external research organization called Focus PVT LTD for an AgriFutures, Australia funded project on seaweed value addition for agricultural inputs along with the director Dr Jane Stanely. I directly contributed to the experimental design, execution of the field experiments, and writing one report and two fact sheets, one on regulatory reforms relating to seaweed use and the other one about practical farm use of seaweeds as outcomes of this project.
Project cost ~ A$ 40,000




January 2020 - December 2023

Ph.D. Candidate, Life and Environmental Sciences, School of Engineering and Built Environment, Deakin University. I completed my candidature at Nutrition and Seafood Laboratory (NuSea.Lab), Deakin University (Deakin Marine) at Queenscliff, Victoria 3225, Australia. As a Ph.D. Candidate I was involved in experimental designs, designing and validating protocols, sample collection, processing, and biochemical analysis of the processed and unprocesssed samples from three different experiments using a Phyllospora comosa (crayweed) macrophytes collected from Victoria, Australia. Further, I built machine learning predictive and classification models using experimental and simulated data. So far, I have published three manuscripts with high impact Elsevier Journals including Food Research International, Food Control, and Algal Research. Two more manuscripts arising from my Ph.D. results are currently being drafted.
Project cost ~ A$ 256,000











2017-2019 : A national level independant scientist and a research manager







Decembre 2016 - August 2019

Scientist, Post Harvest (Marine), National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency, Sri Lanka. As a national scientist, every financial year, I carried out research projects and developmental projects in collaboration with several national and international organisations.




2019

2019 a.

Quality management ISO17025: Method validation, uncertainty measurements, proficiency testing, instrument calibration, repair and maintenance and staff capacity building for the analysis of amino acids, fatty acids, PAH, histamine, protein, and heavy metal content of fisheries products.
Project cost ~ ₨ 1,000,000






2019 b.

Assessment of food safety parameters along the fish and fish products supply chain in Sri Lanka (Heavy metals, PAH, Nanoplastics)
Project cost ~ ₨ 1,000,000






2019 c.

Application of Bionanotechnology in Value Addition to Aquatic Resources
Project cost ~ ₨ 2,000,000




2018

2018 a.

Quality management ISO17025: Method validation, uncertainty measurements, proficiency testing, instrument calibration, repair and maintenance and staff capacity building for the analysis of amino acids, fatty acids, PAH, histamine, protein, and heavy metal content of fisheries products.
Project cost ~ ₨ 1,000,000






2018 b.

Assessment and knowledge-dissemination on quality of fish in newly built in multiday boats, Central Fish Market and selected retail places
Project cost ~ ₨ 3,000,000






2018 c.

Value Added Aquatic Products - . Development of nanolaminated fish oil using chitosan
Project cost ~ ₨ 2,500,000






2018 d.

Evaluation of Bio-active Potential of Selected Sri Lankan Marine Algae
Project cost ~ ₨ 1,000,000






2018 e.

“Colombo Sea Food Festival” - Organising a one week event for vendors and sea food consumers at the heart of Colombo, Sri Lanka for promoting Sri Lankan seafood culture, history and values.




2017

2017 a.

Evaluation of post harvest quality loss assessment of tuna of multiday boat in Negambo, Beruwala, Trincomalee, Dikkovita, Mirissa Fishery harbor

Project cost ~ ₨ 8,220,000






2017 b.

Value added product development using local seaweed species
Project cost ~ ₨ 1,500,000






2017 c.

Polyaromatic hydrocarbon estimation in smoked fish samples
Project cost ~ ₨ 500,000






2017 d.

Radioactivity measurements of fish and seaweed sample collected around Sri Lanka.
Project cost ~ ₨ 190,000











2014 - 2016 : First international academic and research experience







August 2016

Technical expert, All India Coordinated Research Project on Nutrition, PGRC, Hyderabad, Telangana, India. As a technical expert, I devised local protocols used to analyse the anitoxidant and polyphnol content of locally consumed fruits and vegetables in Telangana, India and trained AICRP staffs to conduct these analysis.




August 2015 - July 2016

Masters research student, As a part of my master of food technology thesis, I explored various extraction solvents on extracting, isolating and utilising bioactive compounds from so called insulin plant Costus igneus. I used multivariate models to explore the data sets from this study and published two papers from the thesis and three papers from the collaboration with the Nanotechnology Laboratory, Acharya NG Ranaga Agricultural institute, Tirupati, India.




June 2015 - July 2015

Intern and Nanotechnology laboratory, As a part of my master of food technology course work, I joined the Nanotechnology laboratory in Tirupati to understand and explore the applications of nanotechnology in food science.




August 2014 - July 2016

Master of Food Technology, I was awarded the Indian Council for Cultural Relations, Moulana Azad Scholarship to study two years masters course (1 year course work and 1 year research) in India.
